page.title: 03POLICING IN NEWHAVEN
page.content:
The present police station is in South Road, built over a Roman Villa and opened in 1976. Before this, in 1890 there was a police station in Dacre Road.
At present there is an Inspector in charge and 4 Sergeants plus a number of Constables. Newhaven and Seaford police work together on a rota, inter-changing with each other. They both have mobile and foot patrols known as "Response Units". Sergeant Brown is the liaison officer with Schools. Locally committed crimes include burglaries, car thefts, shop- lifting, vandalism and assaults. All have increased since 1984 together with a worsening drugs problem and 91 road accidents. Criminal cases are tried at Lewes Assize Courts.
